column4: What's the deal when i've downloaded stuff and it don't show up?
Well, i've downloaded VolumeControl and it aint there
doesn't show up in the menus?
if you can figure out what the program is called (to run it in a terminal) you can use alacarte to add it to your menus
in a previous install both breezy and dapper it is just there. This time its not though, should i worry?
in ADD/Remove Programs under sound there is volume control. I also went to synaptics and installed two volume control clients and none show up in menus
oh, i believe those are hidden by default
as i said i always had a volume controller in menus before after installing
start up alacarte (Applications->Accessories->Alacarte Menu Editor) and make sure they've got tick marks in the Sound section
ok, now i feel stupid, Doh...i swear i didn't used to have to do that. It would just be in menus after installing - thx!
It doesn't even get security updates anymore
It'd probably take about 24 hours to upgrade since you have to go from version to version, I suggest you download the Ubuntu 7.10 Release Candidate and do a clean install with it.
i tried geubuntu but had troubles with applications menu in it and they at #geubuntu tried to help me and must have in the process removed the metadata
you seemed to know what is up
